alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 3:51PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland and Prince Edward Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Madisonville, or 7 miles east of Red House, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Farmville, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Hampden Sydney, Darlington Heights, Green Bay, Prospect, Rice, Raines Tavern, Briery Creek Lake, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station, Twin Lakes State Park, Allens Mill, Burkes Tavern, Moran, Kingsville, Elam, Reeds and Prince Edward Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
